alert.note: Alert for Eastern Las Animas County; Las Animas Vicinity, Bent County; Springfield Vicinity, Baca County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 19 at 6:29PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Otero, southwestern Prowers, northwestern Baca, northeastern Las Animas and southern Bent Counties through 715 PM MDT... At 628 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 16 miles south of John Martin Reservoir to 6 miles east of Higbee. Movement was southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain, wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Otero, southwestern Prowers, northwestern Baca, northeastern Las Animas and southern Bent Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM MDT for southeastern Colorado.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Las Animas County; Las Animas Vicinity, Bent County; Springfield Vicinity, Baca County
